intro: Gymnocline macrophylla, commonly known as the broadleaf evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. Native to the mountainous regions of Southeast Asia, this plant thrives in well-drained, acidic soils. It is often found in shaded, forested areas where it forms dense undergrowth. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
